body:
• The Data Protection Act protects everyone’s personal data, including yours. It provides rules on how data should be used and what the rights of the individuals are.
  • We need employee and customer information in order to run our business. We are trusted to look after this information and we all have a responsibility to protect the personal data of our employees and customers.
  • Many large companies have been hacked, had passwords  stolen and  personal compromised data. It could happen to Pret.
  • We work really hard on keeping our systems safe, but we also need you as the “user” of the data to keep the data that you handle and process safe and secure.
  • Change is coming and soon there will be even bigger obligations on how personal data is kept.
  • The purpose of this training is to give you an understanding and awareness of what personal data is and what you should do to keep it safe.
title: Data Protection 1998

body:
Who has a responsibility to keep personal data secure? 

Select the correct answer from the options below and click Submit
title: Question

_items.feedback: We all have a responsibility to keep data secure

_feedback.correct: Correct! We all have a responsibility to keep data secure

_items.body: Handling our employee and customer information with care and respect is critical to protecting Pret’s reputation
Mishandling, losing or sharing this information could lead to Pret being issued with a large fine and bad press

All information you work with has value:
  • THINK before you take it out of the office
  • THINK before you leave it unattended, send or forward it
  • CHECK it is accurate
  • DISCLOSE of it carefully
  • SECURE it
If in doubt, ask yourself how you would like your data to be handled?

body:
• Name
  • Date of birth
  • Address
  • National Insurance Number

  • Right to Work documentation

title: Where can personal data be found?

body:
Which of these items is not/or does not contain personal data?

Select the correct option and click submit
title: Question

_items.feedback: Correct! This does not contain personal data, as the user has openly shared the information

_feedback.correct: Correct! This does not contain personal data, as the user has openly shared the information

title: Request for information
instruction: If you are approached and asked to give information about an employee or customer you should:

_items.body: Not give any information on the phone – you do not know who they are!
_items.strapline: Not give any information on the phone â€“ you do not know who they are!

_items.body: Ask that the request be put in writing
_items.strapline: Ask that the request be put in writing

_items.body: Refer this to your Manager or Ops Manager
_items.strapline: Refer this to your Manager or Ops Manager

body:
If you use your mobile phone to access your Pret mailbox then you should ensure that you:
 
  • Have a secure password on your device
  • Change it regularly
  • Keep your device secure at all times
  • Log a call on the helpdesk to report it immediately to IT if is misplaced or stolen
title: Component title

body: If your company issued phone, laptop or iPad is misplaced, lost or stolen then you must log a call on the helpdesk and report it immediately to IT and your line manager.
title: Component title

body:
• You should only print what is necessary and you should ensure that any personal data or confidential information is destroyed securely.
  • At 75B – you should use the confidential waste bins provided.
  • In shops – we are looking at providing shredders for shops. You will be updated when they are available.
title: Component title

body:
You receive a call from a third party asking if an employee works at your shop, or in your office, what should you do?

Select the correct answer and click Submit
title: Question

_items.text: Be helpful and give the information requested
Explain that you cannot give that information over the phone and ask that they submit the request in writing

_feedback.correct: You should not give personal information over the phone

body:
• All Visitors  to 75B must sign into reception
  • Visitors should be accompanied at all times, whether at 75B or in a shop
  •  If you invite a third party or supplier to visit or work from 75B then they are your responsibility and you should ensure that they are not privy to confidential conversations or information
title: Visitors
What can I do to keep data safe?
instruction: There are some simple steps that we can all take to keep data secure:

_items.title: Desks
_items.body: Don’t leave confidential information unattended on your desk or in your office.

_items.title: Computers, Laptops, Tablets and Mobiles
_items.body:
• Keep your passwords secure. Don’t share them with anyone. 
  • Be creative with your password, use random words and special characters. Don’t use your pet’s name!
  • Use a secure code on your mobile phone
  • Lock your computer when you are away from your office/desk
  • Don’t save personal or confidential information locally on your laptop /desktop– save it to the network or upload to myPret and delete
  • Don’t auto save your myPret password on the shop computer!
  • If you have a laptop then you must ensure that you keep it safe. Do not leave it unattended in public.

_items.title: Email & Systems
_items.body:
• Always check email addresses, contents and attachments before you click “send” on an email
  • Don’t open spam emails  - big risk of viruses!
  • Only use Pret authorised IT systems
  • Don’t use a shared email address to share confidential documents.
  • Don't save on shop or any other public computer

_items.title: Files & Documents
_items.body:
• Keep personnel files locked in a cabinet (or safe) and the key should be with the GM at all times
  • Only print what is necessary
  • Dispose of personal information and confidential information carefully and securely
  • If you export information from the system then it should be password protected
  • Keep secure any documents that you take out of your shop or 75B

_items.title: Telephone calls
_items.body: • Don’t discuss  confidential information about Pret or the people employed by Pret in public areas such as the shop floor, on a train etc.

_items.title: General
_items.body:
• If you view personal data or company information in public then you should ensure that  the information cannot be viewed by members of the public.
  • When displaying customer comment cards, or any other material that has contact or personal info, cut out and destroy the contact info safely

title: Question
instruction: The best way to protect information is to:

_items.text: Use only provided and protected devices to share necessary information with people we know and trust
Whisper on the phone whilst on the train home
Allow access to the system to the team so everyone can access information just in case you are not around and they need it?
